reactions.name: Bayer process (alumina extraction)
reactions.conditions: 523 K; 30 atm; digestion of bauxite in hot caustic soda
reactions.description: Bayer process extracts alumina from bauxite ore. Precursor to Hall-Heroult.

reactions.name: Chloralkali electrolysis
reactions.description: Produces chlorine, sodium hydroxide, and hydrogen simultaneously.

reactions.name: Solvay process (overall)
reactions.conditions: multi-step process using NH3 as intermediate
reactions.description: Overall Solvay process for soda ash (Na2CO3). Key step involves NaHCO3 precipitation.

reactions.name: Solvay process (key precipitation step)
reactions.equation: NaCl(aq) + NH3(aq) + CO2(g) + H2O(l) -> NaHCO3(s) + NH4Cl(aq)
reactions.conditions: 288 K; CO2 bubbled through ammoniacal brine
reactions.description: NaHCO3 precipitates due to low solubility. Filtered and calcined to Na2CO3.

reactions.name: Sodium hydroxide + CO2 (caustic scrubbing)
reactions.description: Caustic scrubbing of CO2 from flue gas or process streams.

reactions.name: Soda-lime glass production
reactions.description: Sodium carbonate lowers melting point of silica in glass manufacture.

reactions.name: Silver chloride precipitation
reactions.description: Classic precipitation. White curdy precipitate. Ksp = 1.77e-10. Used in chloride analysis.

reactions.name: Barium sulfate precipitation (sulfate test)
reactions.conditions: add BaCl2 in dilute HCl to acidified sample
reactions.description: Confirmatory test for sulfate ions. White precipitate insoluble in dilute HCl. Ksp = 1.1e-10.

reactions.name: Saponification (ester hydrolysis)
reactions.description: Base hydrolysis of an ester. Called saponification when applied to fats (soap making).

reactions.name: Cannizzaro reaction (benzaldehyde)
reactions.description: Non-enolizable aldehyde disproportionation to acid + alcohol. Named for Stanislao Cannizzaro.

reactions.name: Calcium carbonate precipitation
reactions.description: White precipitate of calcium carbonate. Dissolves in dilute acid with effervescence.

reactions.name: Strong acid-base neutralization (HCl + NaOH)
reactions.description: Fundamental acid-base neutralization. Enthalpy is -57.1 kJ/mol for all strong acid-strong base pairs.

reactions.name: Sulfuric acid + sodium hydroxide
reactions.description: Diprotic acid neutralization. Two moles of NaOH required per mole of H2SO4.

reactions.name: Acetic acid + NaOH (weak acid titration)
reactions.description: Weak acid-strong base titration. Equivalence point is basic due to conjugate base hydrolysis.

reactions.name: Iodometric titration (thiosulfate)
reactions.conditions: starch indicator turns blue-black with I2
reactions.description: Iodometric back-titration. Starch indicator; blue to colorless at endpoint.

reactions.name: Ammonia from ammonium salt + base
reactions.description: Lab preparation of ammonia. Detected by moist red litmus turning blue.

reactions.name: Flame test (sodium)
reactions.conditions: nichrome wire dipped in conc. HCl then sample; Bunsen burner
reactions.description: Intense persistent yellow flame. Sodium D-line at 589 nm. Masks other flame colors.

reactions.name: Sulfur dioxide generation
reactions.conditions: fume hood required; SO2 is toxic
reactions.description: Lab preparation of SO2 from sulfite salt and acid. Bleaches damp litmus.

reactions.name: Sodium in water
reactions.conditions: violent; Na melts and skates on water surface; H2 may ignite with yellow flame
reactions.description: Alkali metal reacts violently with water. Na melts into a ball, dashes across surface. H2 may ignite.
